message_1: Let $E$ be a vector bundle over a compact, orientable manifold $M$ of dimension $n$ with rank $r > 0$. Suppose that $E$ has a nowhere vanishing section $s: M \rightarrow E$. Show that there exists some real number $c$ and a vector field $v: M \rightarrow TM$ such that $\|\text{d}s(x)(v(x))\| = c$ for all $x \in M$.
message_2:
Since $s$ is a nowhere vanishing section, we can normalize it to obtain a unit section $\tilde{s} = \frac{s}{\|s\|}$. Now, consider the map $f: M \rightarrow E$ defined by $f(x) = \|\text{d}\tilde{s}(x)\|$. Since $M$ is compact, $f$ attains its maximum at some point $x_0 \in M$. Let $c = f(x_0)$. We will show that there exists a vector field $v: M \rightarrow TM$ such that $\|\text{d}s(x)(v(x))\| = c$ for all $x \in M$.

At each point $x \in M$, the differential $\text{d}\tilde{s}(x)$ is a linear map from $T_xM$ to $E_x$. Since $E$ has rank $r > 0$, the image of $\text{d}\tilde{s}(x)$ is nontrivial. Therefore, there exists a nonzero vector $v(x) \in T_xM$ such that $\|\text{d}\tilde{s}(x)(v(x))\| = f(x)$. Define the vector field $v: M \rightarrow TM$ by $v(x) = \frac{v(x)}{\|v(x)\|}$.

Now, we will show that $\|\text{d}s(x)(v(x))\| = c$ for all $x \in M$. Since $f(x) \leq c$ for all $x \in M$, we have $\|\text{d}\tilde{s}(x)(v(x))\| \leq c$. On the other hand, at the point $x_0$ where $f$ attains its maximum, we have $\|\text{d}\tilde{s}(x_0)(v(x_0))\| = c$. Therefore, $\|\text{d}s(x)(v(x))\| = \|\text{d}\tilde{s}(x)(v(x))\| \cdot \|s(x)\| \geq c$ for all $x \in M$. Combining these inequalities, we conclude that $\|\text{d}s(x)(v(x))\| = c$ for all $x \in M$.

Thus, we have constructed a vector field $v: M \rightarrow TM$ such that $\|\text{d}s(x)(v(x))\| = c$ for all $x \in M$.
